info.content:
In the morning Daddy and Ben went out on the bikes with Kieran and Barrie.

Deepcut Jumps

The weather wasn't great so we postponed our walk, instead playing a nice game of Risk. Mummy won. Her mission was to wipe out Katie.

Risky business

We went over to the Elders in the evening where we played Codenames, played computer games and had a yummy roast pork. We saw New Year in on the big cinema screen.

The Krew
Peter Pan

We awoke in Istead Rise. Daddy thought he'd best go on a run to appreciate the local countryside before Ma Ma and Pop Pop move house. He did a 5 mile circular which took in some lovely oast houses and a church. Route

We then scooted home and prepared for the Boxing Day party at our house. 31 people were due!

Needless to say it was manic, but Ma Ma kept it together with some games. All the children played nicely with each other. I think Felicity and Eva's mums are going to get a shock when they arrive home with their hair and makeup done!

The grown up corner

The games room

The games room

It was a 5:30am start for the children. They were under strict instructions that parents could only be woken after 6am with a cup of tea. Bang on 6am teas were delivered and all settled in Ben's bedroom to begin opening what Father Christmas had delivered. Exactly 17 presents each!

After it was Daddy and Mummy's exchange of gifts. A shift of venue to their bed. Mummy loved her wet suit, Fat Face jumper, calendar, Next jumper, socks, nighties, and what seemed to be a problem; a bobble hat.... which she did ask for, but not in blue!

Oops. A blue (not white or black) bobble hat

Daddy gets crisps

Daddy received a new pair of Asics running trainers, some foody bits and a running and biking magazine as well as a bike bag.

Stage 3 of Christmas Day present opening was to take place by the tree downstairs. These were presents from friends. We got some place mats from the Sanders, some cups of chocolates from the Kelley's and some lovely smellies from the Teales.

Friends present opening

A little lull in proceedings before a 9:30 exit to the Fars for breakfast and stage 4.We had a lovely spread of danish baked rolls and bread, fruit, and some nice coffee..... before our traditional game of Coppit. This year Jessica was victorious with her cowardly custard tactics! Daddy opened a couple of presents from the Fars before we moved on to Gravesend.

Christmas Breakfast

We arrived at Istead Rise at 1:30pm and sat down to eat with the Elders and Maisey's at 2:30pm. First year we all sat at the same table. It was the traditional huge turkey and all the trimmings. After we walked to Andrea and Rich who were properly waiting for us. Rich had deployed his drone to track us..... then had rigged up his hose pipe to squirt us from his phone!

Christmas Lunch

Ben outside Andrea and Rich's

Stage 5 - the manic kids presents opening.

Ben's face opening his Quad Bike experience

Stage 6 was adults opening their presents.

In the evening we played games. The game that everyone liked was called 'Codenames'. We all had a good go at it. Some better than others!

A good day had by all.

We played games in the afternoon before heading over to the Fars at about 4pm. We had the usual fare of a treasure hunt around the Tomlins estate, a quiz, Danish Christmas dinner, the dice game and present opening.

Farmor and Jessica

The dice game

Present time

Daddy and the Fars

Team line-up

In the morning Daddy was nursing a hangover on his 222nd parkrun, whilst Ben ran off ahead.

The latest out of the Berkshire walk book was a 4 miler around the muddy Mortimer countryside and the old Roman village of Calleva Atrebatum. Katie came suitably dressed in her heels! In the last mile there was a stream to cross and she managed to end up in it... we later discovered there was a bridge that we could have used to cross the river!

Daddy, Mummy and Jessa

Heading towards the Roman village

Balancing act across the stream. Katie being a kind sister

In the morning we went to get our teeth checked out by the dentist. All good. Then Jessica and Katie went over to Farmor's to bake some giffler, buscuits and sneiler.

Bakers

Daddy went to meet Barrie, Michael, Phil, Nick, Steve and Martin down the Prince Of Wales. Nick announced his engagement to Suzi. Daddy wasn't too well when he returned.

POW boys

title.value: Farmor Baking - Boys Night Down the POW

info.content:
This year we went to Bills Restaurant in Camberley for our family meal.

The gorgeous girls

Bills, Bills, Bills

In the morning Daddy surprised Katie by doing her paper round in the freezing conditions. He then went off to marshall in the Jingle Jog held on the Green.

FF Marshalls

The rest of us went down to Hayling Island and met up with the rest of the family. We saw Father Christmas in the Winter Wonderland, then on to the fairground rides.

Meeting Hayling Islands Father Christmas

title.value: Hayling Island Winter Wonderland, Jingle Jog marshalling

info.content:
Daddy went to parkrun in the freezing cold and ran a 24:43. After he went up to Heatherside where he and Stuart called this morning's game off. Frost. After they went to the Fars, as Ben would put it, to raid their cupboards! Meanwhile Mummy went with church to the two old people's homes in St Catherines Road and sung Christmas Carols to the old folk.

In the afternoon we all went out for a family bike ride. Ben was keen to show some of the tracks we've been on previously. Jessica and Katie were not that enthusiastic and we ended up just exploring the Fuel Allotments and found the swing which was good fun.

Swinging in the woods

After a quick shopping trip, Mummy and Katie went to Gravesend for the annual Teale meal.They met up at the Woodlands along with Ma Ma and Rose. Katie and Summer sat on their own table!

The girls at Woodlands

title.value: parkrun, Carol signing, Family Bike Ride, Teale Meal

info.content:
Daddy was babysitting Toby and Lily. Daddy and Toby made bread, then had a game of pairs which ended 1-1. Meanwhile Mummy took KBJ and Joey to trampolining.

After, Daddy and Ben went to Aldershot cinema and met up with the other Frimley Flyers to see the latest Star Wars film, The Last Jedi. It was excellent. At times through it Ben was shivering with anticipation. They both loved it.

FF Rebels
The Weston girls each year meet up for a meal. Recently it's been held at the Harvester in Puttenham. This year Jessica was old enough to go. Daddy babysat Toby and Joey.

Daddy decided to go for a run.... it started out as a 10km planned run. However, he felt good enough to carry on and carry on..... then at 8.5 miles slowed up and wished he had done a shorter route. Knee pain! Anyway it was his longest run since March.

Route

In the morning Ben went with some of the Elders to see Daddy's Home 2 at Aldershot cinema. It got a thumbs up. Meanwhile Toby went along with the girls to Chris-tingle.

In the afternoon Daddy and Ben went to the Frimley Flyers end of season awards meal held at the Packhouse, Runfold. As Daddy is one of the organisers he provided the league table data and had to present to the group next year's events. In between all of that we had a very nice meal.

FF Awards Lunch

title.value: Frimley Flyers Awards Meal, Ben to see Daddy's Home 2

info.content:
In the morning Daddy went to parkrun and got a season's best time in 24:10. Ben's football was called off last minute due to the freezing conditions.

In the afternoon we had the Glidewells, Elders and Sanders over for a Children's party. Mummy had organised a load of games which the adults were also allowed to join in.

Party Games I

Evie - Give Us A Clue

Ben went to the Elders to sleep the night, whilst Toby was going to stop in with us..... however, after about 30 minutes he wanted his mum, so had to recall the Elders back to pick him up.

title.value: Gay-Glidewell-Elder-Sanders Children's party - Ben and Toby swap sleepover

info.content:
As we went around the Elders a couple of months back to see the America holiday photos, it was kind of an in-joke that we should do the same. Daddy had lined 900 photos up.

We had the Elders, Maisey's and Weston's over to bore them to tears. Needless to say the kids went out on to the trampoline in the freezing cold and dark - which was obviously their preference. The highlight was fish and chips all round.

Mummy and Daddy went out to the Net Evidence Christmas meal held at the Giggling Squid in Farnham. We sat with Tim and Krish and their partners.

Giggling Squid

Daddy went in for his first mountain bike event. He went along with Barrie, Jon and Uncle Michael. It was an early start. The 23 mile circuit wasn't too taxing - although Clay Hill (Beggars Lane) was tough. One to re-visit in better weather.

Route

Daddy and Jon at Newlands Corner

In the evening Mummy went to meet Helen and Fiona for a meal and a catch up and to collect Katie from her weekend away with Summer.

title.value: Dirty Santa, Meet with Helen and Fi

info.content:
Daddy was in a rush this morning. He helped Katie do the paperound before he headed off to parkrun. He was pleased to break 25 minutes. Katie headed off to Summer's where she spent the day with Summer going around Bluewater getting Christmas presents. They had a go on the ice rink too.

Bluewater Ice Skating

Meanwhile Daddy and Ben went to Football over in Bracknell. The Falcons won 7-1, although Ben didn't have a great game.

In the afternoon Jessica went over to Lily's 11th birthday -it was a Bake Off party. Jessica won best decorated cake. She stayed the night along with Lily's other friend, Mae.

Lily's 11th Birthday

title.value: parkrun, Football, Katie shopping with Summer, Jessica at Lily's 11th Birthday

info.content:
Mummy and Daddy went to Camberley Theatre to see and hear James Bond scores being played. Beforehand they went into an eat all you can place in the cinema complex. There must have been 20 members of the band, along with two very good singers.

Q The Music - James Bond Band

Us children went to trampolining as usual, then were looked after by the Fars.

Well what an honour. We received an invite to the Surrey Police Awards Dinner for Katie's role in standing up to the boy at school who threatened to stab another child. In short, a knife was shown and the words 'Do you want to see me stab such and such boy'. Katie and her friends told the school, the police were then involved. Over the weeks Katie friends dropped out one by one, choosing not to give evidence. Katie was the only one left. Without her preparing to testify this boy would have got off and could have caused harm. Katie got threats herself for being a witness. Probably the same to her friends, which is why they all dropped out. So Katie was being commended for carrying through what she had seen.

Programme

We arrived at Guildford Cathedral. The 50 or so guests were to have a dinner in the refectory. We sat at the table with the Chief Constable, Nick Ephgrave and another award winner and her parents. He was a very nice man and we made small talk. He said he could not eat as he got too nervous. Had butterflies.

On table next to Chief Constable

Important policeman kept coming up to Katie through out the evening commending her on her bravery. I think Katie was a little bemused wondering what all the fuss was about.

After eating, the awards began, commending police workers for long service and for heroic acts. Katie was the only civilian to receive an award. She was one of the last. She was presented and walk on to the stage where a Superintendent spent 5 minutes telling the audience of her story (see video clip). She looked confident standing on stage and we were all so proud of her. She was presented a certificate from the Chief Constable, photos taken and a big round of applause. Very well done Kaite.

Receiving Awards from Chief Constable, Nick Ephgrave

It was just boys tonight as the girls went off to Kent for some retail therapy at Bluewater on Black Friday. Katie took her friend Catherine. Mummy and Jess locked themselves out of Ma Ma's house without any spare keys. The next door neighbour was able to come along and take a window out to allow Jessica to climb in and unlock!

Daddy collected Ben from Oliver's and then we went to get chips, a Chinese and some treats from One Stop and stopped in to watch I'm A Celeb in front of the fire.

Cosy Ben

title.value: Girls to Bluey, Boys night in

info.content:
The big match between Joey and Ben.... and Mytchett came out the winners, 3 goals to nil.

After, we went around to the Elders for a yummy fry up and a play.

Lily came over to sleep and watch films with Jessica and Katie.

title.value: Alton v Mytchett, Elders for lunch, Lily Sleepover,

info.content:
Ben dressed up for Hero's day at school. He was part of a production shown to year 8's.

Ben the hero

Mytchett played a team two divisions higher than them in a cup match. They came away 4-3 the victors, played at the Police College in Bramshill. The boys rushed home and went straight out to the Kingfisher for Great Grandma's 92nd birthday meal attended by some of the Barnett's.

We swapped Katie who was staying at Summer's for the night. We had Alice to stay. In the afternoon the Elders popped over for tea and a catch up. We were a little unorganized with Fireworks. It was a last minute scramble to Ravenscote where we joined the Fars to watch the fireworks.

Whizz Bang at Ravenscote

title.value: Football, Great Grandma Birthday, Fireworks, Alice and Joey for sleepover. Katie at Summers

info.content:
Ben and Jess went out with the Panesars, Strouds and Turners Trick or Treating. Katie went out with her friends.

Spooky Jessa and Ben

Boo Hoo our final day - the flight wasn't until 11pm so we had yet almost another full day. It started with Daddy running up and down the strip for 3 miles Route, whilst the rest of us had a lie in. Before checking out we made the use of the pool once more. Daddy wasn't going to, then felt left out so just dived in with his normal clothes on! We headed out of Los Angeles and stopped off at a diner for brekkie.

We retraced a lot of yesterday's route to the Hoover Dam. Parked up and walked across the Dam and back again. It was impressive. The Colorado River seemed so far down. Mummy and Daddy took the extra walk across the motorway bridge to admire the structure from afar.

Hoover Dam

Us children were desperate to go to Walmart to get some holiday presents, so we spent an hour or so getting lost and stacking up on sweets and all sorts of things

Next stop was to see the Mermaid show at the Silverton Hotel. It was stuck out on the edge of town and it did feel a bit B-league. However, the Mermaid show was good to see. A new found love for Subway from the family meant we visited one of their establishments for din dins. We took a quick look around the 'Town Square' before heading to the famous 'Welcome to Las Vegas' sign. Unfortunately we were doing the opposite and saying goodbye. The site was used as a remembrance ground for the atrocity at Mandalay Bay just a month ago.

Farewell Las Vegas

We headed to the airport, dropped the hire car, a Toyota Camy, which we loved and wanted (but discontinued in England). We had a number of hours to kill. Daddy and Ben was drawn in by the Baseball World Series. We learnt the rules and sat, glued to the TV for 2 hours.

The plane home wasn't as fun as the inward journey. First we headed in a Delta Airlines plane (which was late) to New York where we changed to a very old Virgin Atlantic plane home.

Overall I don't think we could have fit anymore in. We certainly maximized our time out there. We didn't get a chance to watch TV or play games in the hotel rooms. A fantastic experience.

Katie 2 part VLog of the holiday.

The LA bits

Travelling to Las Vegas and beyond

The world heritage site of the Grand Canyon awaited us. We went to the closest tourist spot which was the West Rim. On the way we stopped at the fantastically named, Boulder City for some breakfast at Chilly Jilly'z. The drive down past Lake Mead and the Hoover Dam (which we didn't see) was very picturesque and the start of the Grand Canyon park. Two hours passed of monotonous, but scenic driving.

Jessica posing in front of some rocks

A little jaded from the journey, the heat and Daddy constantly stopping for photos we arrived at the Hualapai's grounds. It felt like we had reached some kind of base camp, which it was really. There were domed temporary looking buildings next to an air strip with light aircraft buzzing in and out. We parked up and took the bus to Eagle Point: the glass walkway. We had to deposit cameras in a locker before walking on the glass floored, u shaped bridge. This annoyed Daddy intensely. He let the officials know of his displeasure, and frankly ruined the experience for him. The views were good. We were on the walkway for about 10 minutes. It was a bit of a let down to be honest.

We traveled by bus on to the third stop, Guano Point, which really lifted our spirits. The views from here were so much more spectacular. There was a spit of rock which you could climb to get 360 degree views. Fantastic. Katie was a little too nervous to attempt the trek and Jess was tired. The other three enjoyed some great views.

Family +1 in a Grand Canyon shot

Time was marching on very quickly, especially after faffing around for a very late lunch. We were going to make it for the Hoover Dam so we were resigned to heading back to Las Vegas. We went directly to the strip and after another spot of retail therapy in Nordstrom, we went to the Stratosphere where Ben want to try out possibly the scariest ride in the world, called Insanity. You go 900 feet in the air, get strapped to a chair which is lent forward 70 degrees, dangled off the side of the building, and then you are spun around, pulling 3G's. Mummy closed her eyes. Ben loved it. It turns Daddy stomach just thinking about it. Brave, brave, brave. The stratosphere was in a quite rough area so once finished we quickly exited the area via some tacky gift shops.

We went to the disappointing show in the Forum and the gardens in the Flamingo Hotel. Jessica really wanted to go on an upside ride. The New York, New York Hotel had a rollercoaster going through it which went upside down. Unfortunately she was not tall enough to go on the ride! So it was left up to Daddy and Katie to take the honours. It was quite funny to experience a rollercoaster in the middle of a city. It started off high and did end up going upside down. Again another full packed day.

New York, New York

Unfortunately we had to leave Los Angeles and make the long trip to Las Vegas. We could make it simple and take the motorway route which would take about 4 hours. Instead we found a "scenic route" which takes us south through the Mojave Desert.

As we traveled along we read the guide detailing information about the towns we passed. We went past the San Bernardino mountain range with its mass of wind turbines, through 29 Palms where we tried to swim. It wasn't until we got on to the road to Amboy that we really felt were alone in the desert. The roads were straight, mountains on the horizon and a searing heat outside. At Amboy, a disused town, we saw a volcano, two massive trains and Roy's Cafe. This was the start of the old route 66. Us children weren't that impressed. We just wanted to get to Las Vegas. Daddy scooted along to Kelso and the salt flats, then the big smoke of Las Vegas. Total travel time was about 6.5 hours.

Twentynine Palms

We arrived at the vast Excalibur hotel, which was situated on the strip. It was like a fantasy hotel with a very large casino on the bottom floor. So many glorified fruit machines, the table of poker, some blackjack, craps and roulette. The hotel was so vast. Finally we got seen to and fortunately got upgraded to the Royal Tower, whatever that meant. Compared to what we had previously the adjoining rooms were luxurious. Each room had two double beds a massive shower and unfortunately a safe which Mummy put the passports and then forgot the combination code she had set! We made a quick trip to the outdoor swimming pool. What we imagined to be a typical hotel swimming pool. Curvey shape, lots of fun beds, music, a bar and a busy, shallow pool. It wasn't really us - we like a deep pool that is quiet. Still we had a nice play.

Graham's brother recommended a BBQ restaurant which we looked up, Rollin' Smoke BBQ. It was a bit off the strip and looked a real locals place. We were the only tourists in an otherwise 90% tourist town. The food was fantastic. The burnt ends were so tasty. We parked the car in a dodgy place and made the long walk through to the Mirage where we saw the Volcano show. We went through Caesars Palace where Katie purchased yet more makeup. $37 for some lippy! We eventually made it into posh Bellagio. After a little explore we stayed to see the fountain show.We were knackered, so Daddy and Katie went to get the car 2 miles away to chauffeur the tired crew back to the hotel.

Our Hotel, the Excalibur

Waiting at the Belagio for the fountain show

title.value: USA Day 8 - Road Trip to Vegas

info.content:
Another gloriously sunny day which started for Daddy in a running lap of Disneyland Route but for everyone else a Denny's and a trip to the hotel pool. There was not much enthusiasm from us children about going on a boat for 2 hours. However, hopefully they should learn to give things a chance as this would become their highlight of the holiday. We headed to Bilboa Island at Newport Beach for a two hour whale watching tour. They say whale watching, however there appears to be a 50/50 chance of seeing any whales. Bilboa Island was lovely and relaxed. Many of the holiday houses were dressed for Halloween. Alex our captain took just us on his speed boat out in to sea. Almost straight away we caught up with a pair of Fin Whales, the second largest animal in the world (behind the Blue Whale). They surfaced every couple of minutes. Alex mentioned how lucky we were to see them. Fin Whales were last seen a few months ago in these waters. They were distinctive with their fins which could be mistaken for a sharks. We tracked them for a long way eventually leaving them to head north for a pair of hump back whales. Alex said we had probably picked the best tour of the year. So lucky to see four whales. Although the whales should have been the highlight, the dolphins were the star of the show. Pods of 4 or 5 swum in front of the boat. Fantastico. Love them. At one point there were birds perched on the water, with the whales, dolphins and sea lions. We were very spoilt. After a couple of hours we had to return to harbour as our trip time was up. A fantastic experience.

The whale watching crew

Friendly Dolphins came to play

It was a double exciting day for the girls as it was shopping time. Katie had been researching stores to visit for the past I don't know how many months. There was a Sephora a few miles away in Huntington Beach. Whilst Katie was spending over $300 on make-up (didn't know that was possible), the boys enjoyed the crashing waves and quiet beach.

The hunk at Hutchington Beach

The main shopping event was still to come. We headed back to Orange County and went to its outlet mall. It was like bees around honey. Katie bought so much, even the boys go on in the action! It must have been close to a $1000 total spend. It puts a shudder down my spine.

Girly shopping time

In the evening we headed to the Packhouse for an evening meal. It was recommended by Alex, our captain, as a quirky, trendy place to eat. He wasn't wrong. Mummy had her two favouite meals on a plate: Chilli and Mac. In contrast to the excesses today we were spooked out by a homeless person who was going around the petrol station we had stopped at begging. Such ends of the scale. We felt very sorry for him.

It was an end to another long day which probably in isolation was our favourite.

title.value: USA Day 7 - Whale Watching and Shopping

info.content:
No driving. Hooray. After breakie, we got to Disneyland for the 9am opening. We had a lot to fit in once we arrived on the monorail. The list of rides were: Matterhorn Bobsleigh, Space Mountain, Pirates Of The Carribean, Inidiana Jones Adventure, Jungle Cruise, Autopia, Finding Nemo Submarine Voyage, Alice In Wonderland, Start Tours: The Adventures. None were thrill rides, but it wasn't about that today. The main event, The Parade included loads of characters dancing through the streets. It was quite spectacular. Not quite Frimley Green carnival! We stayed till gone 9pm, so had a full day here. We stopped off at a diner on the way back to the hotel for dinner. After we dipped in to the hotel pool before bed.

Splash Mountain

Iconic Sleeping Beauty's Castle

Tinytoon magical land

A right Micky Mouse lot

After breakfast at Denny's we went for a swim in the hotel pool. Another trip north along the horrendous trafiic this time to Hollywood itself. Another really hot day. The car reported it to be 42 degrees and for the first bit of the day we had to wear 'pants'. We were at the foot of the Hollywood sign hill - it was not easy to get a good photo oppotunity for sign. There were many trees or buildings in the way.

Obligitory Hollywood sign shot

We got to Sunset Ranch for our horsey ride up near the Hollywood Sign. It was like we had reached a different world. The atmosphere was very relaxed and felt like we were cowboys with our horses. Curtis our guide, sized us up at the stables for our one hour trip along the mountain path. Mummy got a horse which was a little lively at first. It was lovely that we were all doing the same thing. First time on horse for Jessica and Ben, and both did ever so well. First bit was a steep incline which Jessica's horse, Magic, decided to trot. It would have freaked the rest of us out, but not Jess, she gave her a little well done 'pat'. The horses were walking right on the edge of the road. One false slip and we would be down the mountain. Funnily enough we all thought what would happen if the horse was suicidal! Then Curtis mentioned how birds and snakes can startle the horses! It made for not a completely relaxing ride. However, it was a lovely experience and one of Daddy's best of the holiday.

A bunch of cowboys and girls

We headed into Hollywood itself and went for a walk up and down Hollywood Boulavard to see the Chinese Theatre and all the stars on the pavement. We stopped off for a much needed drink and lunch in an air conditioned trendy cafe.

Next we went for a drive in the car. First down Sunset Boulavard, then through to Beverley Hills which was very neat and tidy with big, expensive houses. Rodeo Drive was a narrow street with all the top shops. It almost looked fake. We just drove past admiring the expensive-ness of it all.

Next was a longer than expected drive through the residential parts of Bel Air. Another posh suburb. Not much traffic and wound our way up the hill to the top of Stradella Road. We were trying to spot famous peoples houses. Ben and Katie reckoned they saw some big You Tubers house.

It was a painfully long journey back to the hotel due to the traffic again, we went via the infamous Compton. A quick swim before going to the Italian next to the hotel and then walk over to Downtown Disney. There was a Lego, Build A Bear and Star Wars shops. A couple of street bands played which entertained the boys whilst waiting for the girls to appear from the make up shops.

Our Pumpkin

We headed north again, but as the traffic was so bad we went through Los Angeles. It was nice to actually see something other than a motorway. LA looked pretty poor on the whole. We saw the Hollywood sign for the first time on the way through. Eventually we made it to Universal Studios, parked up and headed in on this very hot day.

There were loads of simulator based rides, which sound not as good as the coasters, however, they were done really well. Also we all stuck together as we could all go on everything. We experienced the rides in The Simpsons (simulator), Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey (simulator), Revenge Of The Mummy (rollercoaster), Transformers (simulator), Dispicable Me (simulator), Jurassic Park (boat flume) and of course the studio tour which took about an hour included driving into a couple of tunnels and watching fast action movies portrayed all around you. The 'Waterworld' show was very entertaining. Pyrotechnics, speed boats, acrobatics and a fantastic set. Mummy got the wetest as we all sat in the seats designated for being drenched. Overall, we had a great time here, the queues were not too long, prices not too bad. I think Harry Potter land stole the show. The street looked fantastic. Ben bought a wand from Ollivanders. We also tried Butterbeer, however the hard to describe taste didn't go down too well with us all.

As ever we stayed from opening time right up to closing time, so maximised our stay. Outside there was a shopping mall with various shops that took our interest. We sat and ate at Bubba Gumps. Daddy of course had the shrimp.

The Universal Globe

Harry Potter land

Ollivanders

We took it a bit easier this morning. After a Denny's breakfast, we utilized the hotel swimming pool and jacuzzi. We had it to ourselves and the weather was glorious. Half an hour later we were on our way north again, battling through the LA freeway traffic and reached Venice Beach - home of Muscle Beach. We strolled along the promenade popping into the various t-shirt and souvenir shops. We bought some sunglasses and t-shirts. Some purchases were better received than others! Ben and Daddy watched locals play basketball which was very interesting and tried some of the apparatus around Muscle Beach. The gym at Muscle Beach was very disappointing. It looked weathered and empty. It had seen better days. Ben beat Daddy in a race up the climbing ropes.

We hired a tandem for the boys (Route) and rollerskates for the girls. We had fun for an hour doing our activities. One thing that did strike us was the waft of marijuana everywhere and the number of homeless people. Time was marching on so after Daddy did a quick run (Route), we got back into the car and traveled north up to Santa Monica. It took ages to find somewhere to park. We walked about a mile along the sea front to the brightly lit pier passing some more apparatus to play on. We strolled around the pier and ate at a restaurant with some traditional fare.

Tandem for the boys

Tropical views

Mr Muscle on the beach

Skates for the ladies

Sunset walking to Santa Monica pier

title.value: USA Day 3 - Venice Beach, Santa Monica

info.content:
We woke fairly early. Needing to shake off the jetlag. UK time it's mid afternoon.... west coast time: 7am! We headed over to Denny's (American version of Little Chef) for breakfast. Not a lot of healthy options. The menu choice remained fairly consistent over the next 7 visits.

We headed north in the heat and terrible traffic and eventually reached Magic Mountain, high up on the list in Ben's book. There were over a dozen rollercoasters. Some where you lie flat, lie on your back, stand up, go 100 mph, highest loop. The queues into the park were long, the queues in the park were also long. We mixed it up a bit as Jessica was too short for a lot of the rides that Katie and particularly Ben wanted to go on. Ben and Katie went on: Batman, Superman, Goliath, The Riddlers Revenge and Full Throtle. The rides were very good and we stayed until after dark. It was fright night, so there were characters dressed up roaming the streets going around scaring the park One of the characters came running in and slid on his knees to scare us. Jessica didn't take too kindly to that. We were all very tired by the end. It was a struggle for Daddy to make it home in the car awake.

About to go on first coaster of the day

Goliath at night

title.value: USA Day 2 - Six Flags Magic Mountain

info.content:
Us children had the day off school to go on our long awaited USA holiday. We have been saving and putting off this holiday for over 4 years! Katie had plucked up the courage to take the long flight to the west coast of America. Gemma had helped us book the flights and accommodation. As a result we flew with Virgin Atlantic, a highly respected carrier. All the packing done, Daddy drove us to the Purple Parking place right by the runway.

All was going smoothly, passing the bags in, going through the security gates..... and then Daddy had this 'Did I leave the Iron On type thought' about his insulin. He had planned to pack 2 sets of insulin, one as a contingency. As the bags had been checked in he couldn't verify if he had enough. He was so worried he phoned Farfar to go to our house, take an insulin from the fridge and drive to Heathrow Terminal 3 and somehow get it through security. At this stage there was an hour and a half till take off. However, traffic was not great and time marched on. It trotted on so much that Katie who had gone through to board began sobbing, the flight info stated the gate was closing and still no insulin. Daddy had arranged with security for the insulin to be passed through as Farfar was not allowed to present in person. It finally came, 20 mins before take off. Now the dash to the plane. Of course gate 22 one of the furthest away and to add to the problems, the Heathrow staff shut off the walk way to allow passengers to exit other planes. It was very frustrating as Daddy was in a rush. Eventually he ran through and was one of the last on to the plane much to the relief of everyone, well at least Katie.

Final call for the dipstick

The plane journey was a lengthy 11 hours, but food and drink were regularly distributed and the entertainment system kept us largely occupied. We all watched a number of films, except Daddy who watched documentaries. Boring!

Having arrived it took an age to get through passport control. We picked up the bus and headed to the car rental place. By now we were tired, it was dark outside and we had another lengthy queue. Mummy was accused of being rude when she 'chucked' the id documents to the lady handling our car. Of course we got stung for extra charges. $100 for the toll road machine.... which I don't think we needed in the end.

Driving on the other side of the road, after a long flight in Friday night rush hour on 7 lane motorways was a test. It took over an hour to get to the Best Western hotel in Anaheim. Once there we collapsed into bed and slept well.

Are planned LA excusrsions

It was Oli's birthday party at lunchtime. He had a football party at the 3G pitch at Frimley Lodge.

Virginia Water Totem Pole

Later in the afternoon we went out to Virginia Water to complete Jessica's homework on North America. We walked to the totem pole.

Daddy park runned in the morning before rushing off with Ben to Football over in Hindhead. The Falcons won by a record 9-0. It could have been more if Daddy and Loz hadn't changed the team around so much in the second half. A great team performance.

In the afternoon Katie fell ill, which wasn't to leave her for 4 days. She returned to school on Wednesday.

Last weekend, mummy decided to wash the rug by the fire, which fell apart in the washing machine and clogged the drainage up. Daddy has tried all week to fix it, and enough was enough and a new washing machine was purchased for 380

In the evening Ma Ma and Pop Pop came over and stayed the night as they had to leave early for a camping trip in Tenby.

title.value: New Washing Machine, Ma Ma + Pop Pop Sleepover

info.content:
After school and work we met up with Joey, Lily and Ellie to watch Joseph and the Technicolor Dreamcoat at Richmond Theatre.

The advert

The audience

title.value: Joseph and his Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat

info.content:
• Another sunny day.
  • Dawg somehow not losing the deposit on the bike despite wrecking it.
  • Another lap around the day 1 route.
  • Kingster navigating. "Just follow the road. It's simple"
  • Kingster comes to the rescue with Wing Mirror photo
  • Dawgs dodgy iPhone and song selection. Anyone heard of Bluetooth?
  • Wait to hand bikes over at airport.
  • Copious amounts of methane.
Route

Xalon Krew

Trio doing Castell de Castells route

Day 4 collage

• Solid poker victory for Dawg. (Slop and Mike losing run continues)
  • Slop challenging for a top two finish - Leicester is disguise?
  • Dawg breaks his bike in spectacular fashion.
  • Bazza, Dawg, Jonah lock themselves out. Maria's son abseils through roof to save them. A lot of finger pointing!
  • 13% incline.
  • 25 degrees and sunny
  • We all somehow meet up near Benigembla for lunch and all ride home together. "Will you get out of my slipstream" ~ Dawg
  • Dawg wears shorts normally, bur decides on long trousers for bike rides!
  • Another Slop puncture. Side wall. Mountain climb on 30 psi, and decent again on front
  • brakes only. New tyre needed.
  • BBQ
Route

Stunning views over the coast

Off roading down track after Val d'Ebo

BBQ meal

On the Mikey train

Collage of today

title.value: Costa Blanca Bike Holiday Day 3 - Val d'Ebo

info.content:
• Will he, won't he? Dawg and cycling. Bet he wished it was a "won't he".
  • Dawg falling over in puddle, destroying his cleats.
  • Calpe Monsoon and the hill back home
  • Dawg smacking his head on the wall. (Knocked some sense in/out of him? You decide.)
  • Dawg 20 cleat purchase
  • Slop biking 70 odd miles on 30psi rear tyre. E'ster suggesting to pump it up.... It went down!
  • Epic 9000 ft climbing day.
  • Gravel tracks and mega steep inclines - Lake Guadalest.
  • Another nice meal at the same restaurant.
  • E'ster - an eating machine. Indigestion
  • Nobody passing the man test of getting TV channels properly working
  • Mike continually wimping out of the Calpe route.
  • Bazza taking a fall
  • Dawg discovering party trick of using arse to turn shower on/off/up/down in front bathroom.
Route

Oh no not again

Where are my teeth

info.content:
• Dawg loses wallet and has minor heart failure!
  • All turn up late at airport (E'ster, Robin, Jonah, Dawg, Bazza)
  • Excessive queueing for car rental (E'ster). + bike wandered off
  • Mike takes good manners to new levels letting everyone in front of him in queue
  • Minor Mike sulk when organising effort is questioned and bike goes AWOL.
  • Baz alerts the king and dawg that they are at wrong (south) terminal
  • Kingster , not for the first time pushes in to queue, at airport
  • Mike having audacity to blame Robin for his failure to take a run out in the bus to check on safety of fellow rockets
  • Terrible navigation. Which lane? (Robin)
  • Maria kisses. Dawg almost slipped a tongue in there!
  • Amazing villa
  • Cycle cafe for Tapas and beers (well Dawg and Slop)

Route

Costa Blanca

title.value: Costa Blanca Bike Holiday Day 1 - Serra de Brnia

info.content:
Daddy and Ben went out with the Turners and Stroud's for a Swinley MTB run. This time everyone stayed on their bikes, although Ben did managed a double puncture near the end of proceedings. Conditions were a little tricky down to the damp ground. We all enjoyed it, although I think the boys got a little tired due to the footballing exerts yesterday.

Route

Meanwhile Jessica and Mummy went to church.

In the afternoon we left Daddy at home and we went shopping into Camberley to get some bits. Ben a new headset for the PS4, and the girls makeup.

In the evening the Fars came over to babysit as Mummy and Daddy were given tickets from Ma Ma and Pop Pop to see John Challis at Camberley Theatre. He spoke about his professional life which was quite interesting.

John Challis, Camberley Theatre

Daddy and Ben had an early start going off to Alice Holt parkrun which Daddy ran. It was a tough course. They caught up with the Henderson's which they've not seen for a while. We might meet up next summer to the Henley Mile.

Route

After, the boys moved on to Bordon for their first match of the season, although the team's second. We played Wey Valley who beat us narrowly last week. Daddy was joint manager with Loz (Jayden's Dad). Quite a lot to organise. Ben started as sub as recommended by Daddy, as he was the only player not to turn up last week.

The team played really well, and we won 4-0 in the end. Ben scored the crucial second goal..... with his head. Unbelievable! Smallest person on the pitch. Anyway Big Man was the word of the day as some of the oppo were teasing him because of his height..... he had the last laugh. Daddy got a lot out of it, proud to see the boys play together as a team. No Pre Madonnas.

After a shower and lunch we went over to Auntie Susan's and Grahams house to see their new extension and join in their 40th birthday celebrations. The Fars were there as well as Graham's parents and brother's family. Graham had been cooking the BBQ since midnight last night! The pulled pork was sublime. Farfar had setup a treasure hunt and find the cards for money game!

Phone call received in treasure hunt

Tremear's extension

title.value: Alice Holt parkrun, Mytchett Football, Susan and Graham's 40th birthday

info.content: In the evening we went over to the Elder household along with Char, Ma Ma and Pop Pop to see the ultimate US holiday slideshow. There was a lot of micky taking, mainly at Pop Pop's expense. How pictures of a pelican do you need?

Daddy travelled up with James, Chris and Darren and met Duncan, whose birthday it was, to Kingston. A cheeky beer before hitting the Hippodrome for a rather late 10:30pm start of Feeder. It was a long time ago since Daddy last saw them live. Maybe 20 years! Anyway it was unusual. It was a small venue and hadn't been advertised too much so we got near the front. We got a free Best Of double album on CD and it was just a 40 minute set with no Buck Rogers!

Cheeky beers

Anyway Daddy got amongst it in the Mosh Pit. Love it. It was a late one home

Small stage, near the front

Feeder Flyer

A relatively relaxed and quiet day. Well except from having to get up at 6:30am because Katie was really pushing to go for an open water swim. So we all went along and went in, except Daddy who had a bad neck. Even Farmor came along and had a go. We down to the Quays, paid our monies, put on our wet-suits and in we popped.

Crazy swimmers

Mummy and Jeesica on the final leg

Farmor braving it without a wet suit

No turning back from there

Farmor went in for just a bit as she didn't have or want a wet suit on. The ones with full wet suits said they didn't even get cold. The water was a frosty 15 degrees and the organizers said this was their final session of the year, as it just gets too cold. Ben and Katie had wet-suit issues so came in after 20 minutes. Jessica was loving it and swum a complete circuit.

We finished up and was home at 8am, inviting the Fars a cup of tea to warm up. The fire went on!

Later in the morning Mummy and Ben went off to church, leaving Daddy to do jobs and the girls to design our house on Sims 4!

After a Sunday roast, Ben met up with Yuv in Camberley. After a Frenchies, they went to Yuv's to play and were joined by Oliver.

title.value: Early morning outdoor swim, church, Ben into Camberley

info.content:
A lot of effort, expense and organisation had gone in to this weekend. The plan was to Kayak from Kimmeridge Bay to Durdle Door and back again. Everyone made it, except from us! We set out on time at 8am, but after half an hour we were stuck in a horrendous traffic jam on the M3. The police had shut the motorway and the surrounding area was gridlocked. Cars had stopped and we went out and played 'it' on the fast lane of the motorway! Four and a half hours later we managed to crawl off the motorway. A further 20 minutes to get around the roundabout and back home again... well not quite

Go and play on the motorway

The girls went to the church fair whilst the boys headed to Velmead Road in Fleet and decided to do 6km of kayaking. The 3km time out was 33 minutes. The target was to do 30 minutes on the way back..... and we managed it. Ben did really well on the way back, only resting once or twice.

Route

Kayaking the Basingstoke Canal

We all met up at home and as were going to have Fish and Chips in Swanage, we kept to out word but had them at home instead!

title.value: Gave up after 4.5 hours on the motorway, Kayak and Church Fair

info.content:
In the morning Ben and Daddy joined Kieran and Barrie on a jaunt to Rogate... at first. We heard it was a downhill course, but it was a black run and it was wet. The dads took one look at thought it was too dangerous. Kieran and Ben of course didn't. Anyway after watching other go down, they quickly moved on to QE Park where there was a red run which could be tackled. Again the wet track made the conditions a little tricky especially with the chalk and roots. About 5 miles in Ben came a cropper on the wet. Going straight, Ben hit a stone which made him slide across the chalk and he went down smacking his face on the hard surface! Ouch. It was game over for Ben. Time was up anyway. One for another day.

Route

Rogate

Crash!

Ben's final look

Ben had researched and organised his birthday present to Jessica. He read reviews for the best trampoline park in the area and out of his own money had paid for himself and Jessica to have an hours session. Rush, in High Wycombe had more than just trampolines. It had high walls, high walking poles, pugile sticks, a diving board, spinning arm, etc.. You could not get bored.

Jessica at the top of the high walking poles

If Jessica hadn't been treated enough, it was Katie's turn. She took Jessica into Camberley where they went into the arcades and a trip in Creams for some ice cream.

Creams Crew

title.value: QE Park MTBing, Jessica birthday treats

info.content:
In the morning Daddy volunteered his service at parkrun and was also able to run.... not very quickly though!

Katie went with some school friends to Thorpe Park... again! Ben tagged along. They had a great time.

Jessica, Mummy and Daddy went in to Camberley to spend some birthday money on clothes and a pair of earrings.

Jessica turned 10. We started with opening presents in mummy and daddy's bed. The strangest present request ever was.... lemons. She also opened 240 US dollars, 50 in vouchers, lip balm making kit, a bag, 3 pairs of leggings and a top, a jumper, a J purse, egg face game.

Jessica at 10 years old

Unfortunately it was a school day, but the class all sang happy birthday to Jessica. Daddy took a half day and when everyone returned home in the mid afternoon we all went to Liquid Leisure to go on the water based obstacle course. Normally there would be hundreds of children playing on there, however, because it was an off-peak time, we had the whole place to ourselves. It was a little cold, but the wet suits helped a lot. We had a great time. First we had a race from one end to the other. Ben won, then Jess. Mummy was definitely the least agile of us all. The 50 minutes flew by. The Fars came to watch as well which was very nice.

Inflating the fun in the water

On our way home we stopped off in Frimley Green for fish and chips. A lovely end to the day.

As a lot of Ben's friends were on their holidays in August, we postponed his party till today. He had sleep over at the Elders last night so we didn't see him until 2pm.

First Daddy met up with Uncle Steven and they went for a bike ride in the Heckfield direction.

Daddy and Uncle Steven biking

Route

In the afternoon we had 6 of Ben's friends over (Joey, Oliver, Kieran, Freddy, Jayden and Callum) at the 3G pitch at Frimley Lodge park. To keep it interesting we rotated the teams and gave points to members of the winning team. We had a longer game with extra points and a penalty comp and a long range shot comp. Joey won. The party was finished off with Ben's favourite, Domino's pizza eaten in the rain with an ice cream to finish off.

Pizza time.... in the rain

Daddy's debut as manager had to wait another week. There were not enough players to start the game. So he joined Ben at parkrun. They were alot slower than last week's run.

Defying Gravity

Gone to Donalds

Jessica started yesterday in year 5 with a new 21yo teacher!

Both Ben and Katie were starting today.

School Daze
Ben and Katie were dropped off at Thorpe Park by Far Far who also took Jayden. They had a good time.
Jessica was taken out by Farmor to Camberley where they went shopping for a swimming costume and had a nice lunch.

Ben and Daddy went with Kieran and Barrie to Swinley Forest to ride some of the red trails. Ben loved it. Daddy had a pathetic 'off'.

Route

Ben going down Red 25

The girls went to church.

Straight from church we went off to Hayling Island. The weather was terrible. Needless to say we didn't stay outside on the beach for long. Just went into Funland and Ma Ma treated us to some tokens for us to go on some rides. The wearther did not improve so ended up in the caf for treats.

Ma Ma and Pop Pop stayed over ours as they were going to take out Great Grandma out tomorrow.

Ben and Jessa

Bumper Cars

title.value: Swinley MTBing and Hayling Island family picnic

info.content:
During the week Ben targeted today for a PB parkrun. As such he went to the Frimley Flyers interval training on Tuesday and a 2 hour bike ride on Thursday. Daddy said not to eat within 2 hours of running so he got up at 6am to eat breakfast!

Anyway we arrived at FLP and conditions were good, a little hot, but not too hot that it can be used as an excuse. The plan was that Daddy (recovering fitness) would stick to the PB pace as long as he could. Also they were to start closer to the front so traffic wouldn't be an issue. The pair hurtled off keeping together for the first 2km. At the railway Ben increased his pace slightly, Daddy slowly lagging behind. After lap 1 Daddy shouted 11:30, Ben thought he said 13:30! i.e. He was on PB pace. Anyway Ben kept going, slowing slightly on lap 2 however he came in a whopping 23:22. A new PB. Over a minute better than last week, but more importantly he's 35 seconds off his quickest time. Ben was very pleased with his efforts and obviously exhausted and vowed he could go quicker.

PB Route

Ben's Rio moment

A trip down the caf and a celebration can of Rio was had. Well done Ben.

Meanwhile Jessica had a sleepover at Imogen's last night and went to her pizza party at Pizza Express this morning. She had a great time.

Mummy and Katie were at church club helping out.

In the evening Mummy and Daddy went out for their wedding anniversary meal at the Old Wheatsheaf across the road. They had a nice time. No need for babysitters. Mummy got a beautiful black dress and hoodie. Daddy got a pair of garden shoes with holes in them! The Fars gave them a lot of money also.

Pre Meal Photos (Mummy in new dress)

title.value: Ben PB parkrun, Imogen's 10th birthday, Church Club, 17th Wedding Anniversary

info.content: Ben and Jessica went to Kieran's birthday outing which was a trip to Datchett and the Liquid Leisure assault course. Think that is the third time this summer. The weather was not kind, but the guys had a good time. It was over to McDonalds afterwards where there was a hellium balloon!

In the morning Daddy and Ben were moving / sorting the new wood store that Daddy had built yesterday. All the wood from behind the shed needed shifting. Ben helped and learnt about 'manual labour'! He also used a circular saw for the first time.

On me 'barrow

Katie has a bee in her bonnet about doing an open water swim. So we looked one up and saw that you could go to one of the many reservoirs in Wraysbury. We walked about a bit to find an ideal, secluded spot, but couldn't find one, so settled to a place near the houses. Still it was quite an adventure swimming in a massive lake with no one else around.

Deep, deep water

Jessica and Daddy swam the furthest around the perimeter of the lake. Ben and Katie went in a little early, then found a raft to play with. Ben, fully clothed, then fell in! Dipstick! One to do again that's for sure.

Route

In the evening Daddy, Katie, Jessica and Ben joined the Turners for a bike ride which ended up very dark!

Tunnel Hillers

Route

Not a million miles from Theale, the walk book opened at the 1.5 miles, Hampstead Norey's walk. Shortly after starting we came to a lovely playground which had allsorts of equipment. One was a roundabout which Daddy pushed and pushed. So fast Jessica flew off!

After that little set back we continued our walk through the woods.... which to be honest could have been anywhere.

The old rocket

Route

After Daddy and Ben raced at parkrun (Ben won), the five of us went to Thorpe Park with Summer. It was a hot bank holiday weekend so it was busy. Fortunately Summer has an equivalent to a fast pass so for many of the rides we could get on fairly quickly. Katie went on Saw for the first time ever, and despite having a moment on her first go, she calmed and had 4 more goes! Ben's new favourite ride was Stealth, but sitting at the front. Jessica got scared on the Detonator (drop coaster) but loved it nonetheless. Mummy and Daddy were brave going on any of the rides. Their stomachs are not as strong as they once were. Still we had a lovely day and stayed till the very end. We got fish and chips as a treat for dinner.

Thorpe Park

We took Summer and Oliver down to Hayling Island where we went on the fairground and braved it into the sea.

Fairground fun

Meanwhile Jessica went over to stay with Alice for a day before moving on to Ma Ma's for a couple of days.

title.value: Hayling Island, Jessica over the Teale's

info.content:
After church we popped over to the Fars to celebrate his 71st birthday. We had a nice meal in the back garden followed by a game of Coppit. Some dirty tactics were employed by Ben. He took the cowardly route. Let everyone destroy each other, then appear as the victor.

71 today

The final stretch. A lovely day again. Skipped breakfast in favour of an early start as they had a plane to catch. Daddy headed off north-eastwards whilst the Fars bought the morning food. First was a lovely stop off for morgenmad in Tornby.

Weetabix bales and wind farms. That's Denmark

Great views of the west coast

Next was a fast stretch to the east coast. Daddy recorded his fastest 40km in 1hr 17mis. Not bad after 280 miles of riding. Turning left and heading North for the final 15 miles was lovely along the beach, bike only road. Daddy was surprised to see the horizon scattered with a dozen or so oil tankers. I guess it's cheaper than mooring in port. Skagen was surprisingly larger than expected and not the final stop on the map! Grenen is where the road ends where there are a million and one tourists (mainly German).

Skagen. Made it!

Oil Tanker alley

Grenen. Where the road ends

The trio took a tractor ride out to the most northerly part of Denmark and saw where the Baltic and North Sea's met. It was strange to see the waves of one sea crash against the waves of the other.

Where the Baltic and North Sea meet

Of course when 88km is recorded on the clock the temptation is to make it past the 100km mark, so Daddy decided to re-trace his steps southwards to make it 300 miles (500km) for the 5 days, at the expense of rushing southwards in the car to the airport.

Packing up

Billund was of course very quiet, the plane getting in at close to midnight, then the farce of airport pickup and parking before reaching home at 2:30am! A great trip. It has given Daddy the fillet to do some more A to B cycle tours.

Route

Route

Another good weather day. 80km planned, 103km achieved! The first meeting spot was a Aalborg where there was a lovely looking church. Whilst taking on food and drink we watched a man going around the church yard with a blow torch blitzing the weeds. One way of doing it I suppose.

Stop point in Aalborg

Then came the section to the west coast. Daddy had his own cycle road, beautiful tarmac, straight roads and full steam ahead. Daddy loved this bit as he could really motor at over 30kph. By the time he reached Blochus he was spent, meeting up with a very welcome support vehicle where he took refuge.

Onwards again and this time 8 miles of sandy beach. This proved interesting in parts along the compacted sand roads which cars freely travelled. A touch of lose sand and you were skidding all over the shop. The setting was beautiful the riding was tough.

West coast beach coming

Exiting the beach at the resort of Lkken, Daddy went the long way around to the guesthouse in Lyngby just so he could make it over 100km for the day.

Apres biking pursuits included visiting a large antiques showroom and a trip to Rubjerg Knude, a lighthouse in the middle of what seems a desert. The restaurant f choice today was the one in the townhall square in Lkken.

Hitting the desert

The lighthouse

Route

Route

We awoke to an empty hotel, but the best bit was to come. A trip 5 doors down to a proper Danish bakery. Breakfast consisted of rundestucker and 3 different pastries. We had to work those calories off. Opposite, and the reason why Farfar wanted to come to Allingbro was a bike that went on train tracks! Interesting for the first 20 minutes, then got a bit monotonous. We went down the track, stopping at road junctions. Even Farfar and Farmor had a go. Speed was not great. Still it was a good thing to say you've done.

Train Route

On the bike train

Coming into Allingbro station

So to the ride proper, and a bit of a recovery day after yesterday's exploits. The bottom was starting to get a bit sore on the saddle. First 13 miles of countryside to Udbyhoj was lovely. A chain link ferry took us across the 400 metre stretch of water, then onto Skrping which had a lovely road through it..... but not discovered by Daddy until too late! The hotel was nice, having a pool and a sauna. The room was very basic.... the evening meal was fantastic. Farfar doing his usual trick of adding a design pattern to his shirt with the gravy!

Boat trip

Biking the Jutland countryside

Route

Route

Daddy was intending to do 100 miles, but though he ought to do it after reaching 75 miles. The day started with smoked salmon and scrambled egg for breakfast. Mmm.

The weather was good and Daddy made his way past the church in Ejstrupholm where some of his forefathers are buried, then onto Hampen where his Morfar grew up in the 1920's / 30's. Not sure how different it is now to be honest.

Ejstrupholm church

He made it to the railway at Vrads were they had stopped for afternoon coffee yesterday. Farfar wanted him to take the disused railway line to Silkeborg about 20 miles away. There the three met for a spot of food, before Daddy continued north eastwards out of the city towards Randers. This marked 100km into the day's ride. When he reached Allingbro the milometer registered 75 miles. It would rude not to make it up to the 100, so continued to the coast and beach town of Fjellerup. The final 10 miles were very hard, all up hill seemingly. Still the landmark was achieved so he could rest easy. Another nice evening meal at a restaurant.

Church in Randers

Route

First sign of water at 90 miles

Route

Daddy had a 3am start, to get to Stansted by 5am.... and the airport was heaving at this time of the morning! The Ryanair flight left late, but no matter, time to catch up with some Z's.

Arrival in Billund was met by the Fars, heavy rain and a broken bike bag. Whoops sorry Bob. Then Daddy sheepishly spread himself out in a cafe area and took about 30 mins to re-build the bike which he took out on the plane.

Starting from the airport

So pushed out into the rain and off we go..... well firstly the wrong way down a one way thoroughfare into the airport. The rain was absolutely hammering down which played havoc with the phone which was required for navigation. A few wrong turns on the way out west, past Legoland. The roads were smooth, empty and no pot holes! This positive news far outweighed the stupid weather. Anyway the Fars shadowed Daddy all the way to the rented house in Ejstrupholm. It was lovely and spacious inside. A much need shower was taken and then a hop out to the village and onto Vrads where the traditional Layer Cake on the old station went down ever so well. In the evening we went out for a nice meal.

Route

Route

title.value: Denmark - Day 1 - Fly Ride to Ejstrupholm

info.content:
We awoke with the tradition of having breakfast in Mummy and Daddy's bed and some present opening. Ben got lots of dollars for this year's holiday to America. He also got 'normal' money, a Thorpe Park annual pass and some PlayStation credits.

At lunchtime we went to Alice Holt to first have a picnic, then finally attempt Go Ape. Previously Ben had his leg in a cast. Ben, a nervous-ish Katie and Daddy scaled the heights of trees, whilst Mummy and Jessica went around the smaller obstacle course. Things were going well for the main crew until the rain got heavier and heavier. Then a full on thunder and lightning storm manifested just at the same time we were tackling the big cargo net.... at which point Katie lost one of her shoes. The lightening was freaking her out. Daddy was instructed to turn back, leaving the panic-striken Katie to her own devices. Ben was loving it. Anyway we were told that the place was closed until the thunder storm passed. We decided to end it there and come and finish another day.

Picnicers

Happy Birthday to Ben, Happy ....

Tree Climbers

Ape scaling tree

In the evening Katie was to present her present. We had erected the tent and Katie made it all special with Ben's favourite foods: Dr Pepper, Wether's Original, Dominoes Pizza, Popcorn, Pringles and toasted marshmallows which were cooked over the previously unused chimnea. Ben, Katie and Jessica all slept in the tent that night.

Happy Campers

It was nice to have a semi lie in. Daddy, Ben and Jessica went out with the whole Turner clan for a mountain bike trek around the Tunnel Hill area.

The crew

The Goonies

Katie went to Alice's 14th party at the Quays. She did paddleboarding, which she was more interested just diving from and Ringo'ing, which is when a speed boat drags an inflatable ring around the lake. She had a great time.

title.value: Mountain Biking, Katie Paddleboarding and Ringo-ing

info.content:
Ben and Daddy went to parkrun. Ben was hoping for a sub 25 minute, but came in at 26:02. He was a bit disappointed, but he's not run for 2 weeks. Nothing comes for free!

We were on our way to Weymouth, and took the opportunity to break up the journey by doing one of the walks out of the book. This was walk 93 based around Romsey town centre. The weather was not great, showers. The walk began in the town centre and we decided to share a portion of chips between the five of us. Best chips ever! This fuelled us well over the 4 mile circuit of Tadburn Lake and the housing estates of East Romsey! Route

By the end the weather was really closing in, so it was good to get in the car and head to the coast.

Jessa - The Romsey Flick

Daddy is a well sized raincoat

Animated discussion

Our first cousin third removed, Charlie had organised a surprise 50th birthday party for her Mum, Emma. It was held at her house in Weymouth. We arrived 3 hours into the party. As Emma was a hardened punk in the 80s, we all dressed in punk outfits. OK, maybe it was a bit of a stretch to say we dressed up. Daddy was the only one brave enough to put some headgear on. Black clothing was about the closest we came! Everyone else at the party looked the part. There was a massive gazebo in the back garden which was a bit of luck as it was chucking it down outside. It was to chat to Alan and Tina. I'm amazed at how Tina is so strong with all her medical issues. Strong as an ox. Good on her. She was entertaining as ever. Alan was recalling his trip to Abu Dhabi last year with James and Iolanda. Sounded amazing. Chatted to Gary and some of his friends and of course Emma. The Bullen family are very close nit, living seemingly within a mile of each other. We saw Jack's new addition to the family, Eve briefly. It was really good to catch up with everyone for Daddy. It only happens once in a blue moon. Charlie really made us feel welcome.

Daddy and Charlie (his first cousin, 2nd removed)

The Fars with the Quick's and Linda (on right).

Us with the birthday girl

We stayed for about 2.5 hours and left for home. Daddy was buttered up and done like a kipper and was persuaded to take a detour to Romsey again to get fish and chips from that nice shop from earlier in the day!

Went for a quick 2 hour spin in Tunnel Hill with the Turners.

Uncontrolled entrance and slide at the bottom

Front wheel briefly leaves the ground and for a moment looks a bit worried!

Katie started her birthday with a double paper round with Daddy in not so nice weather. Still cannot pass up a chance for 6.Jessica had then prepared a spa for Katie in the bathroom, complete with candles, melted chocolate and popcorn. It was only 7:30 in the morning!

Jessica prepared spa

Mummy had prepared a breakfast table downstairs for a change where we had croissants and summer fruits. Card and present opening. Now Katie has had a lot of presents over the past few months we've said would count towards her birthday including a new double bed, a Thorpe Park annual pass plus others. Anyway she had a shopping trip in the morning to Primark and New Look where she picked out some clothes and make-up.

Card opening

When we returned home, Summer arrived as a nice surprise. Just in time for us all to go to Pizza Hut which mummy skillfully navigated us to (not!).

Pizza Hut

On the way home we dropped off Katie, Jessica and Summer off at a nail bar in Frimley. Jessica had a manicure and Katie some acrylic nails stuck to her fingers!

Nail bar, nail bar

Daddy brought Katie home, told her to look in the shed where the surprise party guests were hiding! Surprise! Katie's grandparents and great grandma along with the Elders came to celebrate Katie's birthday. Mummy prepared some games, including spoons, a silent auction and Piata. Daddy was on BBQ duties.

Surprise party

Later in the evening Mummy and Katie watched the final of Love Island!

In the morning Daddy and Ben went for a 3 hour MTB expedition with Kieran and Barrie.

In the afternoon we went off to Haethrow to welcome back Ma Ma, Pop Pop, Ellie and Lily from America.

Daddy solo park runned this morning.

Later in the afternoon we picked another walk out of the book. This was a short walk around Hosehill Lake in Theale. We visited Steve and Joyce on our way home.

Hosehill Lake walk

Meanwhile Katie went with Catherine to Thorpe Park for the day. Katie actually tried some of the scarier rides for the first time. They had to leave early due to the bad weather.

title.value: Walk 92: Hosehill Lake, Katie Thorpe Park

info.content:
Today marked the end of year for Katie and Ben. Jessica finished yesterday. In the evening Katie had organised a birthday meal at Bella Italia with 5 of her school chums.

Bella Italia

Catherine stayed for a sleepover after.

title.value: School's Out for summer, Katie Birthday Meal

info.content:
Since Christmas Katie has been rehearsing as Jack's Mother in the production of 'Into The Woods'. She joined mainly because her friend Catherine invited her along. She's been going every Tuesday evening for the past 6 months.

Katie was quite nervous beforehand. She was confident about remembering her lines. It was the singing that she was most nervous about. We gathered quite in the audience: The Fars, Uncle's Graham and Loz, Auntie Susan and Charlotte.

Main characters

Katie had a reasonably large part which included some singing. In the first act, which lasted over an hour, Katie played a poor version of Jack's mother.

A poor Jack's mother

Speaking bit

In the second act Katie played a rich version of Jack's mother and died 20 minutes in!

A Rich Jack's mother

Katie did ever so well. We were all very proud of her. She came out very happy but was convinced she couldn't sing. Daddy thought she did ever so well.

In the morning Daddy and Ben when mountain biking with Oliver and Kieran and their dad's. Ben managed to fall off his bike twice in uncontrollable descents! He managed to break the gear shifter and front brake.

First boys MTBing action

We went to meet with the boy Elders in Hartney Whitley for a spot of fruit picking. Katie waited in the car, with the keys left beside her. She was tapping and swiping away on her phone.... not realizing the keys were next to her. In the previous car we had to lock the car from the inside, so she continued this habit..... locking the keys in the car!

Oh dear. Daddy tried ringing the Fars, to no avail. After the fruit pick, there was no other answer but Michael had to drive Daddy home. He got home, but the spare keys to get into the house were not left in the secret hiding place. So now locked out of the house as well! Fortunately (or not, depending on viewpoint), the upstairs bathroom window was ajar. The upstairs bathroom window however is directly above the conservatory. Yes, daddy got a ladder, carefully drop on the glass roof and slowly managed to crawl through the window! Got the spare set of car keys and rode his motorbike to rescue the fruit pickers!

Raspberry pickers

Beautiful Katie

Sharing a joke

The youngsters eat one, put one in the bucket

Del Boy

Daddy and Ben went to parkrun in the morning. Both ran hard and got into the 25 minutes area. Ben wanting to knock off 1:15mins over the next 5 / 6 parkruns to get a new PB.

Katie had all day rehearsals in Camberley for her impending performance at Camberley Theatre.

Meanwhile, Mummy, Jessica and Ben went swimming after a spot of shopping, whilst Daddy got his haircut.

Arena Action

Katie entered her picture from Boscombe beach huts into a school competition for year 9 and 10's and came third. She also came back saying she got a distinction in a 'Child Development'. Well done Katie.

Third place certificate

title.value: Katie comes 3rd out of 180 in photo competition

info.content:
Breakfast in bed for Daddy and us all as well as some present opening. Daddy's main present was the white water rafting, but also got some food stuffs, some running gear and a cycling magazine.

After work, Daddy was treated to a 3 course meal, each of us selecting a course. Starters was a prawn cocktail, followed by lamb shank and rhubarb crumble. Yum.

The fars popped over later on in the afternoon and gave their presents, had a cup of tea and went through some of the Denmark holiday.

Blowing out the candles

First stop parkrun. Ben ran off from the start and left Daddy in his dust. Ben got 25 minutes as opposed to Daddy's 27.

The car stresses took a notch down after finally securing a car that seemingly works. Much to the distaste of us children, we've got exactly the same car as before, other than it's in better condition and slightly younger! Anyway we've had enough about cars this week! Mega stressful.

Daddy had his surprise birthday present.... a trip to Lee Valley White Water Centre. We are all booked in for a white water rafting

It was the inaugural Frimley Flyers BBQ / Handicap event held at Frimley Lodge Park. The idea is that the runners complete the 5km parkrun course, all set off at different times depending on their expected pace. In theory everyone should finished together. Daddy was injured, but Ben set off with an expected time of around 26 minutes. He struggled on lap 1, but settled his breathing on lap 2 and stormed a sub 25 minute finish..... and WON.

After the race, there was a BBQ and a big game of rounders. A successful event.

Ben's winning plate

Flyers lineup

Meanwhile the girls went off to Istead Rise for a Weston BBQ. It was nice to see Heather and Christine. We had a big water fight.

Weston BBQ

Daddy and Ben went for parkrun this morning and was knackered at the end despite it being a slow 28:30. Meanwhile the girls enjoyed a second trip to the Boot Fair at Mytchett.

In the afternoon Daddy went with James and Emma up to London meeting with Duncan, Kelly and Heather to watch Green Day.

Green Day stage

Rockers

Jessica competed in a number of events on Sports Day. One of which was the sprint hurdles which she won!

Daddy took a day off work to look around for a replacement car. The Astra (MH05 KPF) was up for an MOT next month and needed 700 of work on it. It was also car insurance time, hence we were prompted to quickly get a new car. The list of cars were whittled down to 3 essentially. 2 x Toyota Corrolla Versos and a Honda FRV. Daddy spent a day going around dodgy, West London car sales garages, decided initially against the car he eventually got just because of the colour and all the after market additions. Funnily enough it was a rival car salesman that said it was a good deal and that he should got for it. 4700 later a new car was introduced to the family.

In the evening we cycled to Bellew Road for the Mytchett U12's Presentation evening. All three teams were there and award were handed out. After the BBQ there was a lads V dads football game. There is a dispute over the winners. All I can say is that the Dads scored more goals than the Lads!

Ben collecting trophy

Ben modest about his trophy

title.value: Jessica Sports Day, New Car, Mytchett U12s Presentation Evening

info.content:
Well the first treat for Mummy was the fact she could semi lie in - Daddy was on paper round duties. Then the assortment of presents ranging from new Converse shoes, swimming costume, various items of clothing and some American dollars. Breakfast was pancakes.

We went off to church then we had a Family BBQ in the back garden.

Playing games

Singing Happy Birthday

For Ben's Christmas Present he got a voucher to drive a real car around an airfield. After parkrun we scooted up to Abingdon where we met the Elders and Ma Ma and Pop Pop. Ben reckoned he was going to reach 100mph! Daddy was wondering how he was going to see over the steering wheel!

Joey had a few laps first, then Ben who was very excited. Ben said he reached 70 mph in one of the three laps in the MX5 - which was impressive. The boys then had a pro driver whizz them around the circuit in double quick time.

Ben driving!

It was Ma Ma's 65th birthday so in the evening we went to Worplesdon Place for a meal with all her children and grandchildren in attendance.

Ma Ma's blowing out birthday cake

A select few went off to the Escape Rooms in Merrist Wood. They were looked in a shipping container and had to solve clues to get out within the one hour time limit, which they managed - JUST.

Escape Rooms winning team

Ben and Lily swapped for a sleepover.

title.value: Escape Rooms, Ma Ma Birthday, Sleepover

info.content:
Jessica has a boyfriend, Daniel!

Anyway today she had a school disco, which of course was an excuse to look beautiful in public!

Disco Diva

Daddy woke first at 6am to make bread for his Dad! Then came Daddy's presents and treats. Some lovely cards and presents including a nice leather wristband with our names inscribed. We had the customary breakfast in bed.

Fathers Day present giving

Farfar with Jessica

Daddy then went around to Farfar's to make him breakfast, a big fry up! We joined a little later for a drink and some nibbles.

Daddy and Grandaddy

After church we headed off to the bottom of Box Hill where we met the Weston's / Elders for a picnic next to the River Mole. Then Daddy joined us children in a long walk to the stepping stones through the river. The walk turned into a swim. It was so hot and lovely to play in the water.

In the River Mole

Enjoying the hot river weather

It was baking hot which did not make for a pretty parkrun. Ben accompanied Daddy over the finish line in a little under 30 minutes.

Parkrun

Making the most of the weather we went down to Littlehampton and landed on the beach. Even the water was warm as we swum a bit in the sea. Katie and Jessica just relax in the water on the rubber rings.

Littlehampton Beach

Mummy said there was some good crabbing spots on the boating lake. However, there seemed little sign for this to be the case at Mewsbrook Park despite our best efforts. We tried going into town a bit and saw the Oyster Pond which was full of crabs. However, we were the only ones not to catch any. We collected them off others who were leaving. As we were about to leave Jessica emptied our bucket of crabs. In doing so I think she must of killed 1 or 2!

Jessica Crabbing

We got back home, had a BBQ and attempted to watch Pretty Woman.

Daddy took the long way home via Devil's Punchbowl today

Devils Punchbowl

Route

Day 2 and the rain fell from the skies.... but only a bit. Daddy got 4.5 hours of reasonable sleep before waking and setting off again at 6am for his third and final lap.

Lap 3

Tunnel of love for Alasdair

Flyers Lineup

Medal haul

A great event despite not running to potential, probably the most enjoyable of all the Endure's

Katie and Ben went with Catherine, Jonny and Alice to Thorpe Park. Ben went on Stealth for the first time ever and raved about it when he got back.

Jessica on the other hand went to Frenchies for Amarits 10th birthday party. When she was picked up she was singing along to the karaoke.

title.value: Endure24 Day 2, Thorpe Park, Amarit's Karaoke Party

info.content:
Third year at Endure 24 for Daddy. However, this year he was injury ridden so could not really perform as he would have liked. Arriving at 10:30 the weather was glorious. There were two Frimley Flyers teams, but some friends also entered teams, such as the Longmuir's and Fudge's. Windle Vally and Sandhurst also had representation. Daddy had brought along Anthony who lead the team off to a highly charged opening. The weather was a bit of a killer for quick times. Daddy however, did not set off until 5pm and wanted to take it easy. He posted a 50:22 on a run / walk effort. The first time he's run that distance since April. The knee began to hurt after 3km, so there was a constant battle to know whether to run and damage things further or walk.

Lap 1

Flyers Lineup

Daddy rounding the corner

The same fare in terms of banter, food, supporting, cheering occurred. Night fell and torches were on. Daddy went out for his second run at 10:30pm. This time he managed to run the whole lot including Heartbreak Hill albeit a slow pace. The knee stood up to pace a bit better this time.

Lap 2

Meanwhile the rest of us were picked up by Ellie and driven back to the Elders where we had a Summer Time Ball party in lieu of going to the real thing. We had loads of fruit and we danced our way into the evening. Mummy suffered a lot from Asthma because of Polly, so we had to return back late in the evening.

title.value: Endure24 Day 1, Summer Time Ball Party at Elders

info.content:
A month of two ago Katie had put her name down for a paper round at Candy Mix in Frimley Green as she wanted to earn money..... because she likes spending it! Well we had a phone call over the weekend and she started her 13 house paper round today.... earning 3 a day for a 6 day week. She had to arrive between 6am and 7am.

She's already calculated that she'd be able to take over $600 to America to spend in the malls.

Mummy went with Katie at about 6:30, and completed it in half an hour. Seemed quite easy for Katie.

Route

Katie on her round

Ben returned early from his sleepover at Freddie's.

Daddy went over to cousin Steve's house for a poker night and somehow came second and won 10 overall.

Dorney Lake

title.value: Dorney Lake Aqua Park, Jessica / Summer swap, Poker night

info.content:
